messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 205
messages.msgSnippet: I receive the digest, and my only bug with it is that any attachments posted don t come through, and one has to scan past all the messages, and if replies
messages.messageBody:
I receive the digest, and my only bug with it is that any attachments posted
don't come through, and one has to scan past all the messages, and if
replies don't have the original message removed, it can be hard to follow.
If folk don't want to start snipping, (I said snipping, not sniping...) then
please delete the message from your reply. I swapped one list I'm on from
digest to regular, but may swap back if it gets moved off onelist. Onelist
ain't the easiest format for digests! But OE5 couldn't read the other style
of digests that I'm familiar with, so we'll have to see...

Bws
Tracy
>
> Yes, they are too big. If the size is more manageable, it comes as a
plain
> e-mail. Your suggestion is a good one, but I doubt that very many people
> will really take heed. Anyone else out there receiving the digest verson
of
> the list and prefering not to download it?
>
> Susan (aware that this is a minor problem in life!)
